front.title: Translation of SMIv2 MIB Modules to YANG Modules

abstract.t: YANG is a data modeling language used to model configuration and state data manipulated by the NETCONF protocol, NETCONF remote procedure calls, and NETCONF notifications. The Structure of Management Information (SMIv2) defines fundamental data types, an object model, and the rules for writing and revising MIB modules for use with the SNMP protocol. This document defines a translation of SMIv2 MIB modules into YANG modules, enabling read-only access to data objects defined in SMIv2 MIB modules via NETCONF.
